data.title: Try to fix Travis-CI buffer overflow on JDK7
Fix FBO depth support in OpenGL ES 2.0
data.body:
Fixes `Format.Depth` support in OpenGL ES 2.0. The spec does not allow usage of `GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT` in `glRenderbufferStorage`:
https://www.khronos.org/registry/OpenGL-Refpages/es2.0/xhtml/glRenderbufferStorage.xml

>internalformat
>Specifies the color-renderable, depth-renderable, or stencil-renderable format of the renderbuffer. Must be one of the following symbolic constants: 
		    GL_RGBA4, 
		    GL_RGB565, 
		    GL_RGB5_A1, 
		    GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT16, or
		    GL_STENCIL_INDEX8.

data.title: test and fix for issue #710
data.body: I add a test-case for issue #710 and propose a simple fix.

data.title: collideWith() sometimes reports collisions with phantom triangles

milestone.title: Future Release
milestone.description: Features that will not make it into the next immediate release.

data.body:
Mesh.collideWith() caches a BIHTree for any mesh containing 1 or more vertices, then uses the BIHTree to detect collisions. If the mesh does not consist of triangles (if the mode is Line or Points or anything but Triangles/TriangleStrip/TriangleFan) it generates a BIHTree anyway, treating each triad of vertices in the WrappedIndexBuffer as if it were a triangle. As a result, Mesh.collideWith() sometimes reports collisions with phantom triangles: triangles that don't exist in any mesh.

I believe I know how to correct this issue. I'll write a simple test case and generate a pull request.

data.body: allow easy manipulation of particleemitter via subclasses, eg in my case I want a start color, end color and midcolor.

data.title: Fixed: If Instancing is activated you only see shadows
data.body:
When the pbr material was introduced someone forgot to keep the instancing in mind which uses :
            ViewProjectionMatrix
            ViewMatrix
I added these.

data.title: Fixed sky shader
data.body: Now you can't create a material file of any type for sky, because sky.j3md has the only TextureCubeMap type of used texture even if you don't want to use cube map texture.

data.title: Added Inertia Manipulation Methods
data.body: because I want to get and set inertia

data.title: Update com_jme3_bullet_objects_PhysicsRigidBody.cpp
data.body:
Reset deactivation timer.

From docu here: http://www.bulletphysics.org/mediawiki-1.5.8/index.php/Activation_States
..
ACTIVE_TAG
    Means active so that the object having the state could be moved in a step simulation. This is the "normal" state for an object to be in. Use btCollisionObject::activate() to activate an object, not btCollisionObject::setActivationState(ACTIVATE_TAG), or it may get disabled again right away, as the deactivation timer has not been reset. 
..

data.title: Fix for OpenCLObjectManager
data.body:
This is the pull request that tries to fix issue #695.
 - The call to Runtime.getRuntime().gc() every few frames is removed. The user should be forced to clear the native handles manually. But the automatic cleanup by the gc is still there.
 - Added calls to Reference.clear() when an object is manually deleted.

data.title: Update terrain lod control
data.body:
Added a lit bit improvements for SafeArrayList:
1. improved comparing a SafeArrayList with another SafeArrayList.
2. improved the constructor by other collection
3. added a new constructor with init capacity.

Some improvements with terrain LOD control:
1. Added the new option to use camera from render view port(default false)
2. Removed unnecessary synchronize blocks
3. Replaced each control own executor to global terrain executor
4. Removed unused things
5. Reduced memory allocations
6. Fixed the issue with cloning.

Also, these changes, of course, don't break back compatibility.

data.title: added a possibility to resize env cameras.
data.body: Added a possibility to resize env cameras.

and one optimization in the method to update normals.

data.title: OpenCLObjectManager calls gc every 10 frames.
data.body:
OpenCLObjectManager calls gc every 10 frames if you have at least one native object. Not really a good idea since you may have long lived objects and this code will still call gc every few ms.

Imo GC should be called by the developer when (if) needed and not by the engine.

data.title: Reduce the logging level for OpenCLObjectManager
data.body: OpenCLObjectManager is using FINE level to print the number of active native objects every frame, i propose to change the levels from FINER to FINEST and  from FINE to FINER in order to avoid to have to filter out that class manually.

data.title: Update the water filter
data.body: Just extended availability to edit/save/load the water filter.

data.title: Android support doesn't work
data.body:
The jMonkeyEngine is showing this in the log:
```
*************************************************************************
The "android" command is deprecated.
For manual SDK, AVD, and project management, please use Android Studio.
For command-line tools, use tools/bin/sdkmanager and tools/bin/avdmanager
*************************************************************************
Invalid or unsupported command "update project --target --name Explorations --path /home/spaceboyross/Explorations/mobile"
Supported commands are:
android list target
android list avd
android list device
android create avd
android move avd
android delete avd
android list sdk
android update sdk
```
I have the latest jMonkeyEngine, and the latest Android SDK.
